attributes.action: Offer free paediatric and adult first aid courses
attributes.background: Currently, first aid courses can prove quite expensive. When faced with someone in need, many don't have the confidence or knowledge to give first aid. Free courses can provide everyone with the skills and mentality, and allow them to be able to assist with first aid when needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 5 people will be faced with someone who needs immediate cpr throughout their lives, yet only 39% say they are able to perform cpr. Every minute that passes increases mortality. By offering these courses It allows those who may not have the confidence, knowledge or funding to be able to intervene in situations where lives are at risk, and hopefully, make a difference.

attributes.action: Urge Saudi government to reduce pilgrimage fees
attributes.background: The British government should help British Muslims by passing the message to the Saudi government that British Muslims are not happy with the Umrah fee. Not every Muslim can’t afford to pay the extra fee
attributes.additional_details: Umrah is a spiritual journey for every Muslim all around the world, but for the last two years the Saudi government has made it harder for Muslims. It’s British parliament responsibility to raise our views with the Saudi government.

attributes.action: Fund NHS continuing care for all older people.
attributes.background: Some older people are only entitled to 6 weeks free care and then they are made to pay. Care should be free for all older people.

attributes.action: Ban escort review websites like UK Punting
attributes.background: On certain online escort review discussion boards, such as UK Punting, users submit aggressive & potentially defamatory posts about women. These websites ask for reviews to contain a link, contact details or address of the escort, which can put them at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The posts may contain unfounded accusations and fake reviews. Pictures of the escorts can be posted without consent. Such sites are dangerous to ALL women, not just sex workers. Appearing on them can lead to women being harassed, outed and having their addresses made public, which could result in criminal damage and burglary. Users can even post pictures of women in the street and give derogatory accounts of what they would like to do to them in locked sections of these forums.

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoples’ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you needn’t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Open an independent review into the Misuse of Drugs Act 1971
attributes.background: The Misuse of Drugs Act 1971 is an archaic law that is not fit for purpose in a modern United Kingdom. More and more evidence is being published, proving the safety profiles of drugs that are criminalised by the Act.
attributes.additional_details:
Drugs such as cannabis, psilocybe mushrooms and others that are scheduled under the Act, have genuine uses, whether medicinal or spiritual. The world has changed since the Act was passed, with Canada recently legalising cannabis for adults on the federal level, with Luxembourg next.

This Act has been used to incriminate countless people who did not deserve to be punished and given a criminal record.

It is time the Government asks the Law Commission to review the Misuse of Drugs Act .

attributes.action: Scrap the age pay gap. Living costs don't differ depending on age.
attributes.background: No matter your age, the price of milk costs the same. The difference in hourly wage between those aged under 18 and those aged 25 and over is £3.86. Which, coincidentally, is actually more than the minimum wage for apprenticeships.
attributes.additional_details: There are hundreds of thousands of people in the UK under 25 years old, who live with dependents. People who care for their children, younger siblings, disabled relatives etc. Their age should not impede their renumeration for the same level of work as someone that is simply older than them. Everyone pays the same for petrol, pays the same level of tax, and buys the same food. Let's stop this segregated, illogical pay gap and give people the pay they deserve. The National Living Wage.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory National Service in the UK
attributes.background: By introducing national service, the government would find it a positive force in promoting social cohesion, which would foster and sustain a more vibrant feeling of patriotism and duty and could give people vital skills.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the government could find a way to run this system effectively and in a way which people would be happy with.

At least one year in Nation Service, it could be run like an apprenticeship system where young people would gain a qualification or trade from 2 years of National Service. All of this can be debated and planned through in Parliament... WE HOPE.

The aim of this is to give people a sense of duty, honor and revive some patriotism in future leaders, workers, parents, and educators, etc. across this country!

attributes.action: Make politics easier to understand for younger people
attributes.background: Finding out what each party want to do, especially online, is extremely tricky. There is a lot of jargon, and no website that lays out policies in a simple to understand way. I am a young, totally blind, person in my 20's and the system has left me very confused.
attributes.additional_details: During the 2017 general election, I realized that it was getting difficult for me to find party policies and for me to make up my mind. I propose the Government establish a website that allows users to look at summaries of party policies in a clear, concise, easy to understand, and most importantly, unbiased, way. At the end of these short policy summaries should be a link to that party's full manifesto. I believe that doing this, will allow young people to engage with politics on a much easier level.

attributes.action: Immediate Brexit referendum needing 66% majority (4 options and 1st/2nd choice)
attributes.background:
4 Options: (A) Th. May’s deal (B) Renegotiate with the EU (if the EU declines -> Hard Brexit) (C) Hard Brexit (D) Remain

People vote 1st and 2nd choice
If 1st choice >66% majority - DONE. 
If not, least popular option is removed and 2nd choice taken into account >66% - DONE
and so on
attributes.additional_details:
Immediate as we have had 2yrs of "campaign" no need for more
Invalid responses:
“This is not what the electorate voted when they voted to leave”. The IN/OUT vote did not allow OUT voters to explain their limits. It is a disgrace to hijack the outcome suggesting to understand every OUT voter
“We must respect the will of the people and the democratic process which delivered this result”. (1) the will of the people is not static (2) the political class has failed to in any way create consensus

attributes.action: Make sharps disposal bins free of charge to collect.
attributes.background: I am starting this petition to make the collection of sharps disposal bins free of charge.
attributes.additional_details: I'm starting this petition because I am a type 1 diabetic and I have to use a sharps disposal bin for my insulin cartridges, needles, blood test strips and my blood testing pen drums. Because this is a lot of sharps wastage i end up filling a sharps bin within a couple weeks.The collection of sharps bins used to be free of charge but now there not, you can only have 2 free collections per 12 months and any other collections after would be £5 each time, so I would end up spending £30 or even more per year because I have a lot of sharps wastage from my diabetic stuff. I find this very unfair for anyone who uses a sharps disposal bin as no one chooses to be ill and have to use sharps bin for their wastage and some people might not be able to afford it.

attributes.action: Get paid for clean electricity exported to the grid
attributes.background:
Government plans to end payments for clean electricity exported from new small-scale systems from March 2019.

They propose that people give free electricity to their energy suppliers. This is unfair and will cause a huge drop in the number of installations, placing the UK solar industry at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Two forms of payment to small-scale systems will be removed:

1. Feed in Tariff (on all electricity generated)
2. Export Tariff (on electricity sold back to the grid)

The first is a subsidy, but the second simply reflects a fair wholesale value for electricity sold to the grid.

Residential battery storage is not an economically or environmentally efficient solution. It is better to use and store solar generation at a community scale. This requires a fair price for exported clean energy.

attributes.action: Stop local borough councils charging for replacement recycling bins
attributes.background: The UK Government has a target to recycle 50% of all household waste by 2020.  A recent report showed that we recycled less in 2016-17 than in 2011-12.  Is there any wonder that the general public is recycling less when local borough councils are imposing charges on residents for replacement bins.
attributes.additional_details: South Ribble Borough Council charge £30 for a replacement wheelie bin or £10 for a replacement paper recycling bin, which may have been lost or damaged (blown away) or stolen, through no fault of the resident.

attributes.action: Guarantee supply of & don't raise price on precription medicines after BREXIT
attributes.background:
I have a life long auto-immune disorder. One of my medicines is controlled, only released a month at a time. UK needs to ensure continuing supplies & fixed prices of medications following Brexit.

We need assurances that our essential medicines are available at a price we can reasonably afford.
attributes.additional_details:
The pharmaceutical industry is notoriously aggressive & profit oriented and we, the public, need to be protected from running out of, and being held over a barrel for vital medication following Brexit, especially if we are to leave the EMA.

https://www.ft.com/content/1bd3b34a-f390-11e7-88f7-5465a6ce1a00
https://www.ft.com/content/44304c7e-8461-11e8-96dd-fa565ec55929
https://www.pharmaceutical-journal.com/news-and-analysis/news/brexit-could-hinder-medicines-supply-to-uk-mps-told/20204082.article?firstPass=false

attributes.action: Ask government to force car manufactures to must include spare wheel in all cars
attributes.background: Not having a spare wheel causes , unnecessary waste of time,obstructions, gives stress and force motorists to join a recovery service.

attributes.action: Funding help for clients attending private practice for mental health issues
attributes.background: Clients attend private practice for Counselling/Psychotherapy as advised by GP/NICE guidance and most need help with funding due to financial constraints. Long waiting lists of more than 6 months for charities and other voluntary services. Immediate intervention needed to prevent complex issues
attributes.additional_details: NICE guidance states that individuals struggling with mental health conditions such as anxiety and depression etc benefit from Counselling/Psychotherapy.  Early interventions and home treatment for mental health problems can reduce hospital admissions, shorten hospital stays and require fewer high-cost intensive interventions. This can potentially result in a saving of up to £38 million per year.

attributes.action: Prevent drug-related overdose deaths: trial supervised drug consumption rooms
attributes.background: Supervised drug consumption facilities have been successfully operating in Europe for 30 years. They reduce the risks of disease transmission through unhygienic injecting, prevent drug-related overdose deaths & connect high-risk drug users with treatment and other health and social services.
attributes.additional_details:
Drug Consumption Rooms also seek to contribute to a reduction in drug use in public places and the presence of discarded needles and other related public order problems linked with open drug scenes. Typically, drug consumption rooms provide drug users with: sterile injecting equipment; counselling services before, during and after
drug consumption; emergency care in the event of overdose; and primary medical care and referral to appropriate social healthcare and addiction treatment services.

attributes.action: Continue the renewable energy 'feed in tariff' beyond March 2019.
attributes.background: The Feed in Tariff is the government scheme to provide reward for consumers who install renewable energy devices at home or business. This tariff pays people for the energy created and stimulates green energy growth. This scheme is due to expire in March 2019, we call for this to be continued.
attributes.additional_details:
The Feed in Tariff is the government scheme to provide reward for consumers for renewable energy production by paying people for the energy created and exported to the National Grid.

There are no plans to extend the Feed in Tariff beyond March 2019, which will remove any incentive for consumers to install renewable energy devices, as any energy created will simply flow to the National Grid, with no financial compensation.

We, the undersigned, call for this scheme to be continued.

attributes.action: Tougher laws to protect Fisheries & Rivers from the illegal theft of fish.
attributes.background:
Fisheries & Rivers are being robbed of there fish stocks and the Police just do not seem to hase the powers to effectively stop this from happening.
New laws are needed to enable an effective deterent to be in place, at the moment very few if any are being dealt with, there is currently no deterent
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to make the penalties harder and that would enable the Police and Environment Agency to actually create a respect for this law, the current level of protection is being broken with no fear of the consequences if caught.

attributes.action: Make detentions in schools illegal if the parent's do not give consent.
attributes.background: I believe after-school detentions of students without parental consent should be banned because it is unfair to the parents if they have something planned and occasionally schools give detentions in poor judgement so I think its important to show the parent's opinion on the matter.

attributes.action: Should be a pets NHS. Not every1 can afford their pets ops and treatments
attributes.background: If you can't afford your pets operations or treatments they end up getting put down and its not fair. If your from a working class family it can be hard providing for your family as well as paying huge vet bills. Pets are part of the family!:)xxx
attributes.additional_details: please sign

attributes.action: Transfer the responsibility of A422 Brackley - Banbury to Highways England
attributes.background: The section of the A422 between Brackley and Banbury is used quite heavily by all forms of transport at the moment the road is under Northamptonshire Highways, and not Highways England, plans for a Farthinghoe By Pass have yet to materialise.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the road is closed for a small bridge repair near Farthinghoe.
Which  is causing chaos with minor roads unsuitable for use of high traffic volumes. The road is also a diversion route for M40 Traffic from Junction 10 to 11 vice versa when road accidents occur on the motorway between those junctions.

attributes.action: Make Bonfire Night a National Holiday
attributes.background:
Between August bank holiday and Christmas there are no national holidays in the UK. This leaves millions of people with nothing to look forward to for months on end and has led to the overhyping of Christmas. 
We need another holiday to look forward to. We DESERVE another day of celebration.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we make Bonfire Night a national holiday. The Americans and Canadians have Thanksgiving but it doesn't seem right to copy this. 
Instead let's make the quintessentially British Bonfire Night a national holiday. 
Communities can come together and make/share food. Kids doing 'penny for the guy'. We need this. 
Let's make it happen!

attributes.action: Allow Industrial Hemp to be grown without a Home Office License (4 plants)
attributes.background: I propose a registered scheme with local police to allow UK adults to grow 4 plants of Industrial Hemp ONLY at home without a Home Office License. With tested seeds that are below 0.2% THC. Allowing individuals to grow safe CBD Hemp at home for personal use only . With labelled & tagged plants.
attributes.additional_details:
Iskedjian et al. Meta-analysis of cannabis based treatments for neuropathic and multiple sclerosis-related pain. Curr Med Res Opin. 23(1):17-24.(2007).
 Bergamaschi et al. Safety and side effects of cannabidiol, a Cannabis sativa constituent. Curr Drug Saf. 2011 Sep 1;6(4):237-49.

The fact there has never been a single recorded case of a death caused by CBD or even a psychotic episode caused by CBD . I am in no way endorsing Recreational Cannabis , but urging you to consider this alternative.

attributes.action: Remove the 20% VAT on all e-books.
attributes.background: There is no VAT on physical books so it was unfair for the European Union to apply it to e-books in 2015.

attributes.action: Discuss how supported employment can be made mandatory to include the disabled.
attributes.background:
Looking at figures of the employment sector it is noted that 80% of people without any health barrier are employed compared to people who have health barriers at shocking low of 43.6%.

Figures like these are shocking and need to be addressed such as employers attiude towards disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Below is a link of how supported employment can change and help a person with barriers make the economy and society whole.

This petition is the beginning of inclusion and wider understanding of disability towards recruitment processes within the private, public and self employed organisations.

https://www.mylondon.news/news/south-london-news/unsung-hero-who-helps-disabled-15510468

attributes.action: Review Drink/Drug driving laws and sentencing for offenders.
attributes.background:
Recently a man was sentenced to just 4 years in prison for killing a mother of 4 whilst over the prescribed limit for both alcohol and cocaine. 

The offender in this instance had already served a disqualification for being over the limits.
attributes.additional_details:
Current sentences for causing death or serious injury whilst over the prescribed limit are unfairly lenient.
 
Multiple convictions for over the prescribed limit should carry a lifetime driving ban.

Failure to provide a specimen - This is currently an easier option to hide the amount of alcohol in a persons’ system. It’s loophole which often results in a more lenient disqualification as intoxication levels cannot be established, this should be a mandatory 5 year disqualification.

attributes.action: Reject the Brexit Deal agreed by Theresa May and reopen negotiations immediately
attributes.background: Theresa May and her followers have negotiated a very poor and unfair deal for the UK. Her misguided deal would mean Northern Ireland would have different trade rules than the UK (thus endangering the Union). We would also not be allowed to leave the Backstop (Protocol) without the EU's agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
This deal needs to be rejected by the British people. It does not allow us freedom from the EU and binds our hands. It even agrees to extending the transition period if agreement can't be reached! 
 
It doesn't matter what party you vote for, or whether you are a Brexiteer or a Remainer, EVERYONE who cares for this country has to vote against this awful deal + sign this petition. Read the deal yourself and you'll be shocked at how much sovereignty we'd be giving away. SAVE THE UK!

attributes.action: Make mental health screening mandatory for young and adult offenders.
attributes.background: For too long people going through a mental health crisis are not given the needed support which results in them being put through the criminal justice system instead. This petition is asking for a mental health report to be mandatory before an offender appears before the courts.
attributes.additional_details: According to the National Audit Office in 2016 37% of prisoners in the UK where suffering from a mental health crisis in 2016. They also stated that in the same year there was 120 self inflicted deaths, and a reported 40,161 self harm incidents reported. The cost to the tax payer is staggering and these issues are causing unprecedented pressure on our prison and police services.

attributes.action: Stop UK Government foreign aid to India
attributes.background: UK’s global aid commitment is in the countries national interest, but when £330 million is squandered on a giant bronze statue in India it must be seriously evaluated whether that money could not better be spent at home.

attributes.action: Fund monthly public transport for UK university students to visit home
attributes.background: As a university student, I see many of my peers unable to go home and see their friends and families for periods of up to 3 months due to financial difficulties, even in times of crisis. This impacts them emotionally and has a negative effect on their ability to work and concentrate effectively.
attributes.additional_details: Student finance should ensure students can visit home at least once a month.

attributes.action: Legalise the possession & use of Psilocybin Mushrooms for adults aged 18+.
attributes.background: Psilocybin mushrooms should not be classified as a Class A illegal drug alongside substances like heroin or cocaine. Studies suggest they are non-addictive, have incredible therapeutic value & have no long-term negative side effects.
attributes.additional_details: Psilocybin mushrooms have had documented use by mankind all over the world for hundreds if not thousands of years. They continue to be used today in religious or spiritual ceremony, as medicine or in recreational settings. Their classification as a Class A illegal substance in the UK is ludicrous, myopic and unjust. Consenting adults should be free to use these safe & naturally occurring, native or non-native fungi either as part of a spiritual practice, medicinally or in recreational settings.

attributes.action: Allow severely disabled children to remain in the care home they grew up in.
attributes.background: When children in care reach 18 years old they have to move on to adult services and have to move out of the care home they have grown up in and leave the carers who know them best. Changes need to be made to the relevant regulations for this to happen.

attributes.action: Abolish NI contributions for working women caught in the State Pension Age trap.
attributes.background: Women born in the 1950's have been grievously impacted by the change in SPA and have to continue working. Many of these women have earned the full state pension entitlement by making 35+ years of National Insurance contributions. Such women should be exempt from making further NI contributions.
attributes.additional_details: As an example, take a woman born in 1953. She leaves school in 1970 and starts work full-time expecting to reach SAP in 2013 and retiring. By 2005 she has completed 35 years of work and is eligible for full State Pension. In 2011 she is told she has to work until the age of 66. By 2013 she has paid a total of 43 years of National Insurance contributions. Now she has to work a further 6 years and continue supporting a system that,by now, she thought would be supporting her.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for limited speed vehicles from overtaking on dual carriageways.
attributes.background: Lorries overtaking on dual carriageways takes a considerable amount of time and holds up all traffic behind them. This causes delays and considerable frustration to other road users, and dangerous driving results from impatient car drivers.
attributes.additional_details: The speed limit for lorries on a dual carriageways is 60mph. Cars and other vehicles are limited to 70mph. Considering the numbers of cars to other vehicles on the road, it is illogical to allow limited vehicles to block both carriageways for considerable lengths of time causing delays for many other road users.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that airlines provide carbon emissions information
attributes.background: When travelling by air, it can be difficult to comprehend the environmental impact of your actions. Airlines are well placed to provide information on this, and doing so would empower consumers to make better informed decisions about how they fly.
attributes.additional_details: This information could be provided as part of the booking process.

attributes.action: Review the way interest is added to student loans.
attributes.background: Many young people will never afford to pay back their student loan.  Not only does the current system saddle young people with debt, it is not good for their mental health to know the loan is being added to monthly. The proposal here is to review the student loan interest system.
attributes.additional_details: Reducing interest rates, to be in line with the current Bank of England interest rate plus running cost of a non profit making company, seems to be a much better prospect for young people. The government will have to pick up the bill for any remaining loan, once the student is 53 years old. Let’s make a system work where young people can realistically pay their loans off or a system where the government subsidises all loans.

attributes.action: Decriminalise prostitution to promote safety
attributes.background: Even though their job is legal, prostitution laws prevent women from working together. Sex workers often have to choose between keeping safe and possible arrest, or avoiding a criminal record and putting themselves in danger. No woman should be put in danger by the law.
attributes.additional_details:
About two-thirds of sex workers have suffered violence. Most sex workers are mothers supporting families, prevented from leaving prostitution by poverty. 
 
The Home Affairs Committee recommended that sex workers be decriminalised. Amnesty International called on governments to decriminalise sex work and address poverty by providing a social safety net. New Zealand successfully decriminalised in 2003, improving sex workers’ safety, health and welfare.
 
We call on the UK government to promote safety by implementing the Home Affairs Committee recommendation to introduce legislation to decriminalise sex workers working on the street and together in premises. 
 
Commissioned by the English Collective of Prostitutes. 
 
Visit makeallwomensafe.com

attributes.action: Reconsider the 2017 changes to the structure of the GCSE examinations.
attributes.background: I am campaigning to reverse the 2017 changes to the GCSE examinations. I am petitioning for these changes, such as the 9-1 numbering system and removal of coursework, to be reversed because they actively disadvantage pupils with SEND or who are FSM-eligible.
attributes.additional_details:
According to DfE statistics published in 2017, only 39% of pupils eligible for FSM gained pass grades in GCSE compared to 67% who were not eligible. The changes will widen that gap even further as FSM eligible pupils will not have access to the resources and support they need to succeed.

Headteachers and Teachers Union were united in their opposition to the changes. Pupils should not be judged on their performance in a few hours after two years of study.

'1/3 of employers felt a change to the grading system would add more confusion/complexity.'  (HoC BRIEFING PAPER, Number 06962, 31 March 2017)

Only 20% of people who get a grade 7 or above will get a grade 9.

attributes.action: Make 'Environmental Awareness' a compulsory subject in the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: I want to act in the name of our environment. Look how much has changed in a decade! Images of the declining beauty of our natural environment frustrate me. We need to stop this. Please support me! I am calling on all supporters of this cause!
attributes.additional_details:
This is not an issue that can be contained and alluded to only in geography lessons anymore. 
We need a subject entirely dedicated to educating students about protecting the environment and making them aware from a young age that they need to save it! We cannot stand by and witness the decline of our world anymore. My voice will not be heard without your support!

attributes.action: Require all Blue Badge parking to be free
attributes.background: More & more frequently we are finding that Blue Badge parking is being charged at normal tariffs.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badge holders are the most severely disabled of all with life limiting or terminal diagnosis. 

Holders are restricted to the work they can do and are therefore limited to what they can potentially earn. 
 
Holders generally have increased expenses and are therefore more frugal with the funds available to them that non-disabled persons do not have.

Blue Badge Holders generally have to attend appointments at hospital/s at a greater frequency which also limits ability to earn whilst adding pressures to their earnings.

attributes.action: Give Support workers right to eat their own food in cafes etc
attributes.background: I work as a Support Worker with people with learning disabilities. I love to take them to places to eat out I cannot afford to eat with them. I’d like to be able if possible to eat my pack lunch while they enjoy their meal.
attributes.additional_details: I'd like to see all places where people can eat be required to allow support workers and carers who are supporting a person to eat at their establishments to be able to eat their own food should they wish to do so.

attributes.action: Change the law to end Clearance Fee charges for imported goods.
attributes.background: When ordering items from abroad we have to face a clearance fee of up to £12 on any item we import that have VAT applied by customs. This is excessive. Consumers are being shortchanged to be delivered what is rightfully theirs.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should legislate to end this practice.

attributes.action: Allow British pensioners resident abroad, and their spouses, to have bus passes.
attributes.background: Many British pensioners resident abroad visiting the UK find public transport prohibitively expensive, as they cannot get bus passes. It seems illogical as we get our pensions and can have Senior Railcards. It would not cost the authorities much as we would use the passes for short periods.
attributes.additional_details: When my wife, who is Spanish, and I visit friends and relatives in England, usually in Brighton and London, we use a lot of buses. In Brighton, a network saver costs £4.90 per person per day or £22 for 7 days, which for two pensioners whose friends in the UK travel free is quite a sum.

attributes.action: Repeal the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011
attributes.background: The Act was meant to prevent a hung Parliament after the 2010 general election. It has outlived its usefulness and in the current political situation in the country prevents the electorate from exercising their democratic will.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory in car parks
attributes.background:
Have you ever returned to your parked car and found it damaged by another vehicle? 

If the driver of the other vehicle doesn’t leave a note, they are committing a hit and run offence.

But without CCVT, the chances of catching them are slim and YOU are forced to foot the bill!
attributes.additional_details:
I use NCP assuming it’s the safest place to park. Turns out they don’t have CCTV! My car has been damaged by another vehicle and the driver didn’t leave a note, so I have to foot the bill. It’s nearly Christmas and I have a baby. Somebody else’s cowardly actions mean I have to pay a high excess to claim on insurance and lose my no claims bonus, or pay out more for private repairs.

If you’re sick of paying for others’ crimes, please sign my petition to make all car parks install CCTV. Thank you.

attributes.action: Stop the use of plastic milk bottles and return to glass bottles
attributes.background: Plastic milk bottles generate more toxic waste through recycling than the-using 100% recyclable glass milk bottles. Plastic milk bottles are just as bad as non-recyclable plastics and should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details: Refer to BBC program Blue Planet

attributes.action: Create hospital wards for young adults (16-21)
attributes.background: My daughter has a congenital heart defect and has been admitted to hospital many times in since turning 16 as she is no longer classed as a child patient this means she is put on adult wards which are often mixed this is uncomfortable for any young person.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that all hospitals should have wards for young people to help with the transition between child and adult services, I feel that a young person being placed on an adult ward is daunting, stressful, worrying and uncomfortable. Mixing 16-21 year olds girls with men in their 70’s, 80’s & 90’s or vice versa is not ideal! This needs to change

attributes.action: Give public vote on brexit either to accept the deal or leave with a no deal
attributes.background: We have voted to leave in a fair and democratic vote, we now need to vote on whether we agree with the governments deal to leave the EU or do we want to leave with a no deal

attributes.action: Allow Chris Brown entry into the U.K.
attributes.background: In 2010, Chris Brown was refused permission to enter the U.K. on the grounds of being guilty of a serious criminal offence. Since then, Chris Brown has paid the price for his earlier mistakes and has shown time and time again that he is a changed man through his actions and his music.
attributes.additional_details: Home office stated in 2010, “public safety is one of our primary concerns”, however, Mr. Brown poses no threat to the general public. Instead he is a source of joy to his fans, especially those in the U.K. who can only experience this vicariously through his social media presence. Therefore we ask that you please sign this petition, so our government can consider a reversal of the refusal of his entry to the U.K.
